intro: Ixora seretii, commonly known as the red-rooted ixora, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of vibrant red or orange flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes other well-known genera such as coffee and gardenia. Ixora seretii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a hedge due to its dense growth habit. Its roots are also used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties.
